p: As shown in Table 6, some of the uridine esters have improved dipole moment. Improved dipole moment enhances the polar nature of a molecule, and promotes the binding affinity, hydrogen bonding and nonbonding interaction with the receptor protein (Lien et al., 1982). The dipole moment of compound 4 was 7.588 Debye and for compound 15 was 7.619 Debye which were slightly higher than the uridine (7.339 Debye) resulting their better binding affinity and interactions with the amino acid residues of receptor protein.
